intro: Dianthus hymenolepis subsp. bingolensis, commonly known as the Bingöl carnation, is a rare flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while the flowers are arranged in clusters. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique floral morphology.
